context: The word 'läki' is an imperative form of the verb 'läheb' (he/she goes) in Estonian. It's used as a command telling someone to go or leave, similar to saying 'Go!' or 'Leave!' in English. In different grammatical forms, it appears as 'läksin' (I went), 'läksid' (you went), 'läkseme' (we went), etc.
